metadata.Title: CVE-2020-16012 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Side-channel information leakage in graphics in Google Chrome prior to 87.0.4280.66 allowed a remote attacker to leak cross-origin data via a crafted HTML page.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-16012` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 87.0.4280.66-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-browser-l10n - 87.0.4280.66-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-chromedriver - 87.0.4280.66-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 87.0.4280.66-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 87.0.4280.66-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
No subscription required

firefox - 83.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.2
firefox-geckodriver - 83.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.2
firefox-mozsymbols - 83.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.2
No subscription required

thunderbird - 1:78.8.1+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:78.8.1+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:78.8.1+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:78.8.1+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:78.8.1+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:78.8.1+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
No subscription required

notes.Note: tyhicks> mozjs contains a copy of the SpiderMonkey JavaScript engine

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '87.0.4280.66-0ubuntu0.18.04.1').
firefox package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '83.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.2').
mozjs38: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
mozjs52 package in bionic is affected and may need fixing.
thunderbird package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:78.8.1+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1').
